dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5118 IH: Protecting Law Enforcement from Doxxing Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ogles introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to establish a criminal prohibition on the public release of the name of a Federal law enforcement officer with the intent to obstruct a criminal investigation or immigration enforcement operation.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Law Enforcement from Doxxing Act.

section.header: Prohibition on public release of name of Federal law enforcement officer

subsection.text: Section 1510 of title 18, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in the heading, by inserting and immigration enforcement operations after criminal investigations; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Releasing name of Federal law enforcement officer

paragraph.text: In this section, the term Federal law enforcement officer means any officer, agent, or employee of the United States authorized by law or by a Government agency to engage in or supervise the prevention, detection, investigation, or prosecution of any violation of Federal criminal law or immigration law.
It shall be unlawful to make the name of a Federal law enforcement officer publicly available with the intent to obstruct a criminal investigation or immigration enforcement operation.
Any person who violates paragraph (2) shall be fined under this title, imprisoned for not more than 5 years, or both.
The table of sections for chapter 73 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 1510 and inserting the following:

toc.toc-entry: 1510. Obstruction of criminal investigations and immigration enforcement operations.

subparagraph.text: Section 1961(1) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 1510 (relating to obstruction of criminal investigations the following: and immigration enforcement operations.
Section 2516(1)(c) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 1510 (obstruction of criminal investigations the following: and immigration enforcement operations.
Section 3142(h)(2)(C) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting after 1510 (relating to obstruction of criminal investigations the following: and immigration enforcement operations.
